explanation: Not correct. MISRA 2.2 forbids code that is executed yet provably removable without changing program behaviour. The per-algorithm sizeof checks in this function are defensive guards that compare the stored hash-field size to the incoming userhash_size; they are reachable and only provably redundant if, for every possible value of algo3, MHD_digest_get_hash_size(algo3) is guaranteed (and provably so across the whole project) to equal sizeof(user_ids[0].<corresponding_field>). From the excerpt provided there is no proof of that invariant. Removing the checks would change behaviour in any scenario where the mapping between MHD_digest_get_hash_size and the actual sizeof fields differs (due to a bug, a future change, or different handling of session variants), so the comparisons are not necessarily dead code. If, however, you can show project-wide that MHD_digest_get_hash_size() is implemented in terms of those exact sizeof expressions (and that the relationship cannot change), then the checks would be provably redundant — only in that stronger, project-wide case would Agent A’s claim be correct.
